metadata.title: CVE-2021-32719 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
RabbitMQ is a multi-protocol messaging broker. In rabbitmq-server prior toversion 3.8.18, when a federation link was displayed in the RabbitMQmanagement UI via the `rabbitmq_federation_management` plugin, its consumertag was rendered without proper <script> tag sanitization. This potentiallyallows for JavaScript code execution in the context of the page. The usermust be signed in and have elevated permissions (manage federationupstreams and policies) for this to occur. The vulnerability is patched inRabbitMQ 3.8.18. As a workaround, disable the`rabbitmq_federation_management` plugin and use [CLItools](https://www.rabbitmq.com/cli.html) instead.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32719` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

rabbitmq-server - 3.9.8-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rabbitmq-server package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.8-6').
